title: IS 447 Final Project: Exploring Wine Quality through Advanced Data Techniques
description: In our IS 447 Final Project, we navigated the complexities of Wine Quality data, starting with the consolidation of separate datasets into a singular, structured CSV format. We employed ydata-profiling for in-depth data analysis, focusing on generating critical metrics like Mean Squared Error, Root Mean Squared Error, and R-squared values to gauge our predictive model's accuracy. A key deliverable was our comparative visualization, highlighting the alignment between actual results and model predictions. Our project's backbone was a snakefile-driven workflow, complemented by the use of a virtual environment for software dependency management and Docker for enhanced reproducibility. Comprehensive documentation via Markdown captured every phase, ensuring clarity and replicability in our approach to data management and analysis.
notes: The code part of this project (reside in GitHub repository) is licensed under the MIT License. Please refer to the LICENSE file in the repository for more details.
